docs.lead_paragraph: FROM her hermitage at the top of the Storm King Mountain, where she resides nine months of every year, Mrs. Amelia Barr plowed her way through snow drifts to civilization last week, arriving in New York just in time for the fine, gelatinous mud which had settled down over the city.

headline.main: Decline of the American Girl.; Mrs. Barr Deplores Changes in 75 Years, but Hopes for Future
